meanings.definition: To clean with a vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent1: Mom is hoovering the living room carpet.
meanings.sent2: I need to hoover the car before our road trip.
meanings.sent3: The robot vacuum started hoovering up my socks!
meanings.sent4: The vacuum cleaner was hoovering up dust bunnies like a hungry monster.
meanings.sent5: The sound of hoovering always reminds me of cleanliness.

meanings.sent1: I don't mind doing the hoovering around the house.
meanings.sent2: The hoovering of the office is scheduled for tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The hoovering competition at the fair was intense.
meanings.sent4: The hoovering of the concert hall was completed in record time.
meanings.sent5: The hoovering left the room looking spotless and fresh.

meanings.definition: To consume or inhale quickly and greedily.
meanings.sent1: He was hoovering his food as if he hadn't eaten in days.
meanings.sent2: The kids were hoovering up all the candy at the party.
meanings.sent3: She was hoovering the popcorn at the movies like there was no tomorrow.
meanings.sent4: The team hoovered up all the snacks during the break.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies had everyone hoovering them up in seconds.
